meanings.definition: The act of identifying too closely with a particular group or ideology.
meanings.sent1: Overidentification can lead to a loss of individuality.
meanings.sent2: She struggled with overidentification with the popular clique at school.
meanings.sent3: His overidentification with the superhero made him wear a cape to work.
meanings.sent4: The overidentification with the team's success blinded him to his own failures.
meanings.sent5: The therapist warned about the dangers of overidentification with a political party.

meanings.definition: The process of assigning multiple identities or characteristics to a single individual or group.
meanings.sent1: Overidentification in this case can cause confusion.
meanings.sent2: The overidentification of the suspect led to a mistaken arrest.
meanings.sent3: The overidentification of the cat as a dog made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her overidentification of the painting as a masterpiece was questioned by art critics.
meanings.sent5: The overidentification of the actor with his famous role made it hard for him to find new roles.
